alert.note: Alert for Baker (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Baker, northeastern Columbia, east central Hamilton, southeastern Echols, southeastern Ware, southeastern Clinch and Charlton Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Argyle to 8 miles north of Fargo to 14 miles east of Needmore to 6 miles southeast of Belmont. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Fargo, Stephen Foster State Park, Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, St. George, Belmont and Sanderson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
